nodes.text: A male Mirialan served as an ensign in the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry during the Galactic Civil War, operating aboard the bridge of the CR90 corvette Thunderstrike. In 3 ABY, the Thunderstrike was infiltrated in the Elochar sector by some Imperial spies who captured the ensign and four others.

The rebel soldier Brand arrived at the bridge and the remaining bridge crew helped her defeat the spies by wrestling them. The two remaining ensigns then took to their stations at the bridge and the Mirialan argued to Brand that they needed to activate the corvette's shields, but was overruled. The Thunderstrike escaped shortly after with its escort.

During the Galactic Civil War, the Mirialan served as an ensign in the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry, better known as Twilight Company. He was stationed aboard the bridge of the company's CR90 corvette, the Thunderstrike, serving under Commander Paonu, who led ship operations. In 3 ABY, the Thunderstrike and its escort, the Braha'tok-class gunship Apailana's Promise, rendezvoused with an Alliance flotilla in the Elochar sector for repairs. However, some Imperial spies were able to infiltrate the corvette by posing as survivors from a damaged freighter.

Lieutenant Sairgon attempted to contain them from the bridge by locking the Thunderstrike down, and when the spies reached the bridge, the lieutenant prompted the rest of the flotilla to flee before being killed. The Mirialan ensign and four others were then captured by the infiltrators. After the rebel soldier Brand entered the bridge and fired at the spies, the ensign and the other surviving bridge crew wrestled their captors. The bridge crew defeated multiple infiltrators, who fired back at her, while Brand killed the others. By this time, the Mirialan and another ensign were the only remaining crew.

Brand, assuming command as Paonu had been killed, ordered the pair to get to their stations and one of them reported that the Imperial II-class Star Destroyer Herald, which had since arrived to deal with Twilight Company, was firing at the Thunderstrike and Apailana's Promise. Brand told the ensigns to get ready to jump the Thunderstrike into hyperspace. The Mirialan, while focusing on his control panel, argued that they needed to activate the corvette's shields. Brand overruled the ensign, insisted that the Thunderstrike could take a hit to escape immediately. She also sent coordinates to the Promise and the two vessels fled into hyperspace under fire.

The ensign was a male Mirialan with yellow skin and black tattoos covering his face. When Brand insisted that the Thunderstrike needed to jump to hyperspace immediately, the Mirialan was more insistant on activating the corvette's shields, focusing on his control panel as he argued his point to the soldier.
The Mirialan ensign appeared in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed.
